The research characterizes the molecular preservation and stable carbon and nitrogen isotope compositions of these reeds using chromatographic techniques and isotope analyses. llm_processed_output.source_summary: The provided text is an abstract of a Master's thesis focusing on art, society, and memory in the context of the Sahrawi refugee camps. The author's project, 'Repasos,' is a collective creation addressing the disappeared people of the Sahara. This work utilized embroidery as a metaphor for memory and aimed to symbolically mend the suffering of the Sahrawi people living in exile. The thesis examines the relationship between art and craft, the historical connections of these practices with women, and the broader context of contemporary art and the 'other.' It addresses the political conflicts causing disappearances in the Sahara and the resulting exile of the Sahrawi people, who have lived in refugee camps for 37 years as of the thesis's defense date in 2012.
